head.supplied: ¶ [Baron von Mueller — asking for [particulars] re Marram grass to be forwarded to Natal and Western Australia] ¶ The minute adds: 'Full particulars to be forwarded'....

div.p: Minute book 10, 01 October 1890 - 23 May 1894, p. 387, VPRS 11097/P0001, Port Fairy Borough Council records, VA 2488, Public Record Office, Victoria.

Letter not found. The text given here isfrom'Correspondence inward' in the minutes of the meeting of the Port Fairy Borough Council, 21 June 1893.
The Port Fairy correspondent for the Warrnambool standard reported: 'There have been received, through Baron von Mueller, applications from distant places for seeds or plants of the Marram-grass, from Natal, South Africa, and from Western Australia and New Zealand. Mr. S. Avery, an expert in its plantation and growth, has prepared directions as to its cultivation, and the photos prepared by him, showing its growth and habit, are highly esteemed by all who have been supplied with and successfully established under his directions, this magnificent stay grass.' (Warrnambool standard, 24 June 1893, p. 4). See also Port Fairy
gazette, 23 June 1893, p. 2.
[Baron von Mueller — asking for [particulars] re Marram grass to be forwarded to Natal and Western Australia]
The minute adds: 'Full particulars to be forwarded'.
